info.title: SANDBOX REST API
info.description: Welcome to the Rest API documentation. Don't have API keys? Login or create an account here to get started.

tags.name: shipments
tags.description: The Shipments API is used to create, list, and delete your shipments

tags.name: boxes
tags.description: List all boxes of the customer

post.summary: Schedule pickup for shipment and PickupDetail

403.description: Wrong shipId. This shipId exists but does not belong to you.

409.description: Conflicting request. Pickup is already dispatched

204.description: Currently no pending pickups for this shipment

delete.summary: Remove shipment from pickup. This method does not cancel the shipment. It only removes it from pickup batch.

get.summary: List all boxes of the customer. The list includes both custom boxes added by the customer, and standard courier boxes.

get.summary: Lookup location for country and zip/postal code

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Two character country code. Only "CA" and "US" allowed currently.

post.summary: Get rates post method. Submitting a properly formatted request will yield rates with different available couriers.

400.description: Bad request. The request was invalid because the body was missing a required parameter and/or the parameters did not conform to data validation. See error messages in body.

length.description: Length of the package (IMPERIAL: inches/METRIC: centimetres). If a decimal number is declared, please limit the fractional part to two digits

width.description: Width of the package (IMPERIAL: inches/METRIC: centimetres). If a decimal number is declared, please limit the fractional part to two digits

height.description: Height of the package (IMPERIAL: inches/METRIC: centimetres). If a decimal number is declared, please limit the fractional part to two digits

weight.description: Weight of the package (IMPERIAL: pounds/METRIC: kilograms). If a decimal number is declared, please limit the fractional part to three digits

nmfcCode.description: National Motor Freight Classification Code of the item, Only for PALLET Packaging type

freightClass.description: Required only for International PALLET Packaging type.

LineItemModel.description: Represents an item in a shipment

currency.description: Currency of this invoice (USD or CAD)

pickupDate.description: The date of the pickup. Has to be on a business day in most cases. (Format: "yyyy-MM-dd")

readyTime.description: The time the shipments will be ready for pickup in 24 hour format. (Format: "HH:mm")

closeTime.description:
Latest time the pickup can be done in 24 hour format.
Cannot be later than pickup cutoff time provided along with the rate quote.
Normally there must be few hours interval between readyTime and closeTime. (Format: "HH:mm")

PickupDetailModel.description: Represents pickup information either in a request or in response. The pickup address will be the origin address of the shipment.

dutiable.description: Is the shipment dutiable? Non-dutiable are shipments with no monetary value and are known as documents or general correspondence. All other shipments classified as dutiable shipments by Customs and may be levied customs duties and taxes for entrance into the destination country.

paidBy.description: Who pays duties and taxes? (Consignee or Shipper)

state.description: State or Province. Required for CA and US

postalCode.description: Postal Code or ZIP code. Maximum: 10 characters.

attention.description: Recipient's Name. Minimum: 2 characters. Maximum: 40 characters.

phone.description: Phone Number. Minimum: 10 characters. Maximum: 15 characters. For Canada and USA the format should be NNN NNN NNNN, for other countries adhere to the E.123 international notation. Example, +22 607 123 4567

state.description: State or Province. Required for CA and US

postalCode.description: Postal Code or ZIP code. Maximum: 10 characters.

attention.description: Recipient's Name. Minimum: 2 characters. Maximum: 40 characters.

phone.description: Phone Number. Minimum: 10 characters. Maximum: 15 characters. For Canada and USA the format should be NNN NNN NNNN, for other countries adhere to the E.123 international notation. Example, +22 607 123 4567

unitOfMeasurement.description: Units of measurements of package dimensions and weight: inches and pounds for IMPERIAL, and centimeters and kilograms for METRIC

insuranceType.description: Insurance type, defaults to CARRIER if not specified

RateRequest.description:
Rate request with shipment parameters. It, generally, should be exactly the same during rating and shipping to ensure quote and billing amounts consistency.

Please note that carrier APIs usually apply more stringent data validation when placing a shipment than during rating. For example, address field lengths have various restrictions depending on label design; phone number validity gets checked to ensure delivery, etc. These all may not be applied during rating for which sometimes only postal codes are enough.

But, to make sure the same rateRequest works well during rating and shipping, please, take care to fill out shipping details accurately and enter textual fields as short as possible especially when it comes to address details so it fits on a label. Keep in mind that label fields restrictions are different from carrier to carrier.

carrierId.description: Carrier Id selected based on previous rating result

serviceId.description: Service Id of the selected carrier

quoteId.description: The quote Id referencing a selected quote from rating response. Will only be used if no other parameters are present in request, otherwise is ignored.

ShipRequest.description:
Represents request to create a shipment. If all properties are set, the rateRequest, carrierId, and serviceId will be used and quoteId is discarded.Note that shipment charge will be based on the rateRequest and the shipment billing amount may differ from the amount of the quote. This can happen if rateRequest is altered, that is not the same as during rating.

In order to ensure billing consistency between rating and shipping one can use the quoteId only in shipRequest, without setting other properties.

Note, that the quoteId is only valid for about 15 min since rating.

description.description: Description of the item. Maximum: 50 characters

provinceOrState.description: Province of Origin. Required by some carriers (ex. CanadaPost) when country of origin is CA

unitPrice.description: Unit price of one line item represented in cents

weight.description: Weight of one line item. Note that most carriers require that total invoice weight of invoice items does not exceed the weight of shipment.

InvoiceItemModel.description: Represents the items in a commercial/customs invoice. Note that many carriers require the total insured value amount of a shipment to not exceed total customs value amount

ShipResponse.description: Represents results of request to create a shipment

ShipmentDetailResponse.description: Represents a shipment details when retrieved by its shipId

id.description: Pickup id. Can be used to reference pickup when deleting or removing a shipment from pickup

confirmationNumber.description: Pickup confirmation number. Note that confirmation number is not unique. For uniquely identifying a pickup the carrier id and date will normally be required.

shipments.description: ShipIds of shipments included in the pickup

PickupModel.description: Represents pickup summary. All shipments in a pickup will have the same address of origin.

success.description: Pickup request failed if messages contain "success == false"

PickupResponse.description: Results of pickup cancellation or modification

AvailablePickupsResponse.description: Results of searching for available pickups for a shipment

BoxResponse.description: Represents results of request Account's boxes

cutoffTime.description: Represents the pickup cutoff time. Usually it is tied to an origin of the shipment

accessTimeInterval.description: The minimum required time interval between the ReadyTime and office CloseTime. Default: 2 hrs

quoteId.description: Quote Id is uniquely identifies rate request and a quote and can be used to create a shipment based on this rate request and quote. See ShipRequest for details.
